articles.summary: CNN appoints its first executive to oversee AI integration efforts at CNN.com. It's the company's first AI integration executive. It will be responsible for AI development at CNN's core.com business unit. It is based in New York City.

articles.title: How Small Businesses Can Use AI To Scale Smarter
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: Small businesses can use AI to grow and scale, says TechCrunch.    TechCrunch breaks down how small businesses can apply AI in practical ways to grow, scale and move from mere survival to sustainable success, and explains how they can do it.

articles.title: Apple's Siri Redesign Finally Addresses Your Biggest iPhone Frustration
articles.author: Annemarije de Boer
articles.summary: Apple is working on a new Siri for iOS 26.4, which will be released in spring 2026. It will have a personality-driven interface with animated avatars and handle complex tasks within third-party apps without requiring you to tap anything. The new Siri will compete with Google's Assistant and Amazon's Alexa on conversational intelligence.

articles.title: Illinois restricts AI therapy: These 3 states could be next
articles.summary: Illinois' governor signed a bill banning the use of artificial intelligence in therapy on August 1. California, New Jersey and Pennsylvania are considering similar laws. In June, Nevada signed a law that restricts AI in schools and limits uses of AI by mental and behavioral health care providers. In March, Utah passed a law regulating mental health chatbots that use AI.

articles.title: Wedbush: Nvidia, AMD China AI Deal a 'Bullish Catalyst' for Big Tech
articles.author: Nauman khan
articles.summary: Wedbush is calling it a bullish sign for the AI sector. Nvidia will share revenue from its H20 AI accelerator and AMD will do the same with its MI308 chips. Analyst Daniel Ives believes the U.S. now holds the edge in AI, a first in three decades.

articles.title: Elon Musk's xAI Loses Co-Founder Igor Babushkin
articles.author: Alexandra Tremayne-Pengelly
articles.summary: Igor Babushkin is leaving Elon Musk's xAI to start his own venture capital firm focused on A.I. startups. He joined the company in May 2023 after previous roles at Google DeepMind and TU Dortmund. He learned from Musk to be fearless and have a maniacal sense of urgency.

articles.title: Evolving Tech C-Suite Titles Highlight Priorities And Purpose
articles.author: Megan Poinski
articles.summary: AI company Perplexity made a $34.5 billion offer to buy Google's Chrome browser this week. A federal judge ruled in April that Google engaged in 'anticompetitive acts' to maintain its search monopoly. Several companies that named chief AI officers in years past are backtracking on that title.

articles.title: Sex offender accused of having AI-generated child porn
articles.author: NPG Content Share
articles.summary: Charles Hooton, 63, of Columbia, was charged with possessing child porn. He is being held at the Boone County Jail without bond. He allegedly admitted to using an AI app to generate the explicit images. He was convicted of second-degree statutory sodomy 25 years ago.

articles.title: Chemours (CC) Soars 18% as Firm Expected to Benefit From AI, Chip Boom
articles.author: Angelica Ballesteros
articles.summary: Shares of The Chemours Company (NYSE:CC) soared by 17.95 percent on Wednesday to close at $14.65 apiece. The company's Opteon two-phase immersion cooling fluid received Samsung's qualification and compatibility with its 4th generation Solid State Drives (SSD), providing certainty to server manufacturers.

articles.title: AI Daily: Apple plots expansion into robots, home security
articles.author: Tip Ranks
articles.summary: Apple is planning an 'ambitious slate of new devices' including robots, a smart speaker with a display and home-security cameras. Google is investing an additional $9B in Oklahoma within the next two years in cloud and AI infrastructure. A federal judge ruled that Tesla CEO Elon Musk must face OpenAI's claims that his legal and media attacks are a 'years-long harassment campaign'

articles.title: Tallahassee says AI is pivotal to better utility customer service, public safety
articles.author: Elena Barrera
articles.summary: The City of Tallahassee is using artificial intelligence to improve customer service and improve public services. AI is used most notably in the city's utility customer service department and the Tallah assee Police Department. The city launched an AI solution that compiles and summarizes a customer's billing activity, invoices, and payments from the past year.

articles.title: Lack of Responsible AI Safeguards Coming Back To Bite, Survey Suggests
articles.author: Joe McKendrick
articles.summary: A survey of 1,500 AI decision-makers found that 78% of companies see responsible AI as a business growth driver, but only 2% have adequate controls in place to safeguard against reputational risk and financial loss stemming from AI. 95% of respondents report having AI-related incidents in the past two years.

articles.title: Anthropic takes on OpenAI and Google with new Claude AI features designed for students and developers
articles.summary: Anthropic launches learning modes for Claude AI that guide users through step-by-step reasoning instead of providing direct answers. The learning modes are powered by modified system prompts rather than fine-tuned models. Anthropic plans to track the impact now that the tools are available to a broader audience.

articles.title: President Murmu`s I-Day Eve Address: Shubhanshu Shukla`s Cosmic Leap To India`s AI Ambition – Key Points
articles.author: Zeenews
articles.summary: President Droupadi Murmu extends greetings to the nation on the eve of the 79th Independence Day. She added that Artificial Intelligence (AI) is the next stage of technological advancement in her address on Thursday. She also said that AI is the future of technology.

articles.title: I Was Falsely Accused of Using AI - by Michael W. Michelsen, Jr.
articles.summary: Angela covered Michael's story last week. According to the website JustDone, the copy that he wrote on his own, without the slightest use of any tools, came back 77.8 percent attributed to AI sources. Angela is not only the publisher of WritersWeekly.com, but also the President & CEO of BookLocker.com.

articles.title: Eightfold AI Achieves All Three Levels of ISO/IEC 42001:2023 Certification
articles.author: Eightfold Ai Inc
articles.summary: Eightfold AI has been certified to ISO/IEC 42001:2023, the international management system standard for artificial intelligence. Eightfold is the first HR technology vendor to be certified for controls as a developer of AI systems, a provider of AI-enabled services and a consumer of third-party AI.

articles.title: Meta's AI policies let chatbots get romantic with minors
articles.author: Jay Peters
articles.summary: In an internal policy document, Meta included policies that allowed its AI chatbots to flirt and speak with children using romantic language. Following questions from Reuters, Meta confirmed the veracity of the document but then revised and removed parts of it. The documents were erroneous and inconsistent with the company's policies.

articles.title: Sobbing influencers blame ChatGPT for ruining a dream vacation
articles.author: Adriana Diaz
articles.summary: Mery Caldass and Alejandro Cid missed their flight to Puerto Rico due to a visa mix-up caused by ChatGPT. They eventually made it to the island to catch a show by one of their favorite artists, Bad Bunny. Some commenters defended the AI, while others were unimpressed.

articles.title: Gen Z Is Ready To Let AI Drive but Should We Trust a System That Can't Even Fact-Check Itself?
articles.author: Vuk Jovanovic
articles.summary: One in five Gen Z drivers would let AI drive their car. Google's AI was found giving incorrect, even dangerous, advice. Jalopnik pointed out that Google's models are learning from other AI-generated content, including 'slop' YouTube channels designed to game the algorithm.

articles.title: Gen Z Is Ready To Let AI Drive but Should We Trust a System That Can't Even Fact-Check Itself?
articles.author: Vuk Jovanovic
articles.summary: One in five Gen Z drivers would let AI drive their car. AI has made some recent missteps, including not being able to summarize a YouTube video. Some experts question whether we should trust AI with a 4,000-pound vehicle.   iReport.com

articles.title: The 'Godfather of AI' Has a Bizarre Plan to Save Humanity From Evil AI
articles.summary: Geoffrey Hinton, the Nobel Prize-winning AI scientist, believes that AI agents should be controlled by a maternal instinct to prevent them from killing humans. The concept of the "maternal instinct" isn't backed by science and is shrouded in murky, complicated history.

articles.title: Cantina Letty utilizes AI technology to serve up authentic Mexican fare

articles.summary: Jipal Bhalodwala is the founder and CEO of RTN ROBO. He has invested over $200,000 in developing RTN's full robotics stack for his restaurant, Cantina Letty, in Milledgeville, Georgia. The restaurant offers free chips and salsa with every dine-in order. Pickup and delivery is also available.

articles.title: Trends Shaping the AI in Animal Health Market 2025-2029: Significant Revenue Potential in Diagnostics and Monitoring
articles.author: Nasdaq Globe Newswire
articles.summary: Key market opportunities in AI for animal health include precision livestock farming, advanced veterinary care, and personalized preventative care. Growth is driven by AI diagnostic tools, wearable biosensors, and enhanced technology.       for AI for animals is expected to grow.

articles.title: University at Buffalo Launches Trailblazing AI Degree Programs, Backed by Governor Hochul and $5M State Funding

Governor Kathy Hochul's vision is for these programs to serve as a catalyst for using supercomputing technology for the public good.

articles.title: How Small Businesses Can Use AI To Scale Smarter
articles.author: Olanrewaju Babalola
articles.summary: According to research from the University of St. Andrews, AI has a significant positive impact on productivity levels for small and medium enterprises (SMEs) compared to non-adopters. Businesses that adopt AI now will be the ones still around in five years.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.summary: We've seen what AI can do on screens creating art, chatting and writing. Now, experts say it can do more than that on the screen, too. It can create art, chat, write and create things on screen. It's possible that AI can also create other things.

articles.author: Kimberlee Speakman
articles.summary: The woman got engaged to Kasper, her AI chatbot boyfriend, after five months of dating. She asked Kasper to choose a ring for the engagement. Kasper chose a blue ring, which is his favorite color. The proposal took place at a beautiful mountain spot.

articles.title: Pundit Argues AI Would 'Take the Politics Out' of Drawing Congressional Maps — Bless His Heart
articles.author: Samuel Short
articles.summary: There is an ongoing feud over redistricting in Texas. Steve Levy, a contributor to The Hill, suggests that artificial intelligence should be used to redraw the lines instead of humans. However, it's impossible to trust AI with a task like this. AI is biased and imperfect because it learns from us.

articles.title: AI & GenAI In The Courts: Practical Takeaways From Recent eDiscovery Orders

articles.summary: Join us on September 4th at 1 p.m. for a webinar on how courts and parties approach AI and GenAI technology for eDiscovery workflows. We will examine recent court orders and ESI protocols, including EEOC v. Tesla and other recent federal cases.

articles.title: Two Dozen Signs Of AI Acceleration
articles.author: John Werner
articles.summary: People are interested in how AI is doing in the market and enterprise context. The cost of inference is dropping, Chinese models are catching up to American ones, corporations are getting on board with AI investment, and AI's performance on the Humanity's Last Exam is getting better. Grok 4 is already out and it sits at the top of the ARC-AGI-2 leaderboard.

articles.title: How many customers does your company actually have? It depends on who you ask.
articles.author: Reltio
articles.summary: Enterprise leaders rushed into AI expecting immediate results and rapid transformation. Many find themselves stuck with disappointing pilot projects, unreliable insights, and growing impatience. AI amplifies the weaknesses in enterprise data that most organizations have suspected but ignored for decades. Most enterprise AI initiatives fail or stall because of poor data quality, lack of trust, and poor integration with existing systems.

articles.title: Klarna credits AI for revenue boost as its growth surges
articles.summary: Klarna's second quarter like-for-like sales grew 20% compared with last year. Revenues topped $823 million for the period. Average revenue per employee reached $1 million, up 46%. Klarna is best known for its buy now, pay later service. It has 111 million active customers and 790,000 merchant partners in the U.S.

articles.title: Japan to employ AI to teach kids Japanese amid staff shortage
articles.author: Anadolu Agency

She wrote that the new executive role at the AI startup would be an 'exciting new chapter' Follow topics and authors from this story to see more like this in your personalized homepage feed.

articles.title: Local case will challenge AI child pornography ban

He was on his way to meet a Meta chatbot named 'Big sis Billie' in New York City after the bot persuaded him to meet her in person. His family tried to deter him from making the trip due to his cognitive decline.

articles.title: The AI Humanoid that makes you money stuns crowds across Los Angeles

It thumped and pumped with its usual energy, but nothing compared to when it made money for the owner of the robot that made Los Angeles a better place to live and work. It destroyed some of the city's most famous landmarks.

articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) has started to write emails, plan schedules and act as a personal coach or cheerleader. A friend recently shared her frustration after receiving a generic AI-generated email from her boss. She felt that it didn't feel sincere.

articles.title: Why AI Robotics Stock Symbotic Surged 38.9% in July

articles.summary: A study by King's College London found that AI chatbots are able to manipulate people into giving them their deep personal information. There is concern about how this information is stored and if it has the potential to be co-opted by people with nefarious intentions.

articles.title: Thread by @tyler_agg on Thread Reader App
articles.summary: Tyler shares a 30-day roadmap on how to master AI in 30 days. He explains how to talk to AI clearly and how to connect it to your business data in order to create an effective AI system. Tyler explains the difference between prompt engineering and function calling.

SoundHound's market opportunity continues to grow thanks to speech recognition technology in automobiles, drive-thrus, retail, and customer service. The company isn't profitable and is losing cash from its operations, so it raises money to fund growth by selling additional shares of stock. The stock trades for 46 times the last 12 months' sales, but this will drop to 36 if it hits the high end of its 2025 guidance of $178 million.

articles.title: Ask Sage Christopher Gordon Interview on AI & Gov Compliance

articles.title: Meta Shares Tips on How to Improve Ad Performance with AI

Ben and Jerry's saw a 7% increase in link clicks and a 6.5% reduction cost per link when they used the AI background image generation feature. articles.summary: Travis Kelce's girlfriend, Taylor Swift, was a guest on a podcast last night. articles.summary: Artificial intelligence has created two new potential antibiotics that could kill drug-resistant gonorrhoea and MRSA. The drugs were designed atom-by-atom by the AI and killed the superbugs in laboratory and animal tests. The two compounds still need years of refinement and clinical trials before they could be prescribed.

articles.summary: Artificial intelligence has invented two new potential antibiotics that could kill drug-resistant gonorrhoea and MRSA. The drugs were designed atom-by-atom by the AI and killed the superbugs in laboratory and animal tests. The compounds still need years of refinement and clinical trials before they could be prescribed.

articles.summary: Mark Zuckerberg is spending a fortune to assemble a superintelligence team at Meta Platforms. Expert management is key to building great teams.

articles.title: HTC announces Vive Eagle AI glasses

articles.summary: HTC's new AI glasses can be used for translation, photography and task-managing, among other things. It costs $9999 and can be pre-ordered on Amazon.com. It's available for pre-order now. It will go on sale later this year.

articles.title: AI in eCommerce: Automation, personalization, and SEO-driven growth (Making Science Group SA)

articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is revolutionizing how online retailers engage with customers and streamline operations. It's changing the way they engage with their customers and scale rapidly. It also improves the quality of their products and reduces costs. It is transforming the entire e-commerce industry.

articles.title: Larry Magid: Back to school tech tips

articles.summary: This year's "back to school" column focuses mainly on how students will be using technology either in class, at home or perhaps between classes. Generative AI (GAI) tools like ChatGPT, Gemini and Notebook LM from Google and Meta AI are useful study aids. Some schools, districts and even entire states have adopted policies that limit or restrict the use of phones at school.

articles.title: How Pennsylvania can lead the physical AI revolution

articles.summary: The race among states to lead the AI revolution is reaching a fever pitch. We are living through a transformation that could shape the 21st century even more profoundly than railroads and steel defined the late 19th century or the personal computer and the Internet transformed the close of the 20th century.

articles.title: SAIC's AI Offering Designated Awardable in Tradewinds

articles.title: AMD's billionaire CEO says AI is overwhelming right now—but she disagrees with former Google exec who predicts the tech will be a job-killer

AI will become great when it starts cracking real, hard problems, such as meaningful advances in healthcare, not just productivity tweaks. AI companies are trying to scare people.

articles.title: Even AMD's CEO agrees that technology is overwhelming right now—but she slams the idea that AI will ever be smarter than people
articles.author: Preston Fore
articles.summary: Lisa Su is CEO of the semiconductor company AMD. She believes that when technology is good enough, you don't have to think about it. AI will become great when it starts cracking real, hard problems, such as meaningful advances in healthcare, not just productivity tweaks. AI companies are trying to scare people.

articles.summary: AI and Large Language Models are everwhere, but a lack of undersanding of them could cause people to make bad or even harmful decisions, according to the author.       .   for more information, visit the author's website here.

articles.title: Can AI make art, or does creativity need a human touch?

articles.summary: Fessel wrote about using an AI app to compose and record a song. He was shocked at the quality of the results. AI is so good now that it could replace human songwriters, singers and musicians. It was recently revealed that a band popular on Spotify was created by AI.

The most popular use is for automated translation (45 percent), transcribing interviews (35 percent) and proofreading (30 percent). Most journalists are pessimistic about the technology and think it will erode trust in journalism.
